data.message: I love how Spain still do coke in a glass bottle and pick up the empties to recycle! Surely that is better than continuously making plastic ones? More easily reusable being glass no?

replies.message: Hi Gem, at this stage, we’re working hard to ensure that our packaging is as sustainable as possible. Plastic has lots of benefits and is fully recyclable. It’s much lighter and uses less material than glass. It also can’t get broken easily so it’s safer. As long as it’s responsibly disposed of, it can be recycled and reused into other packaging or fibre. In the UK, the industry and retailers stopped using refillable packaging many years ago partly because of the space and complexity required to manage this type of system. They will always remain an option for future sustainable packaging. However, it’s a change that would require a significant reinvestment and a change along the whole supply chain in the UK. In our strategy for Great Britain, we’ve focused on the actions we think will make the biggest impact in a near future.
